revision_history.draft:
Streetlights blink in 40-cycle hum,  
shadows stretch across asphalt veins.  
Concrete ribs exhale,  
bats pulse ultrasonic threads  
through the grid’s unblinking eye.  
Neon signs bleed through grime,  
transformers groan in their sleep.  
A firefly’s glow fractures the dark—  
a single, stubborn voltage  
in the city’s static pulse.  
Darkness contracts around the last flicker,  
leaving only the hum  
of a clock’s gears,  
stuck between midnight and morning.

Streetlights blink in 40-cycle hum,  
shadows stretch across asphalt veins.  
Concrete ribs exhale,  
their breath a hum of fraying wires—  
bats stitch ultrasonic threads  
through the grid’s unblinking eye.  
Neon signs bleed through grime,  
transformers groan in their sleep.  
A firefly’s glow fractures the dark—  
a single, stubborn voltage  
in the city’s static pulse.  
Darkness contracts around the last flicker,  
leaving only the hum  
of a clock’s gears,  
stuck between midnight and morning.
revision_history.critique:
**What’s alive:**  
The poem thrives on mechanical and biological imagery, grounding the urban night in concrete details: “40-cycle hum,” “concrete ribs exhale,” “bats stitch ultrasonic threads,” and “firefly’s glow fractures the dark.” Enjambment stretches the tension between light and dark, and the closing image of the clock’s gears stuck between midnight and morning ties the city’s pulse to its own machinery.  

**Issues:**  
1. **Weak line break** at “Concrete ribs exhale, their breath a hum of fraying wires—” (line

final_poem:
Streetlights pulse in 40-cycle hum,  
shadows stretch across asphalt arteries.  
Concrete ribs exhale,  
their breath a hum of fraying wires—  
bats spin ultrasonic threads  
through the grid’s unblinking eye.  
Neon signs ooze through grime,  
transformers groan in their sleep.  
A firefly’s glow fractures the dark—  
a single, stubborn voltage  
in the city’s static pulse.  
Darkness contracts around the last flicker,  
leaving only the hum  
of a clock’s gears,  
trapped between midnight’s breath and morning’s hush.
